fields.description:
I can see there are a lot of javadoc warnings for YARN codebase if ran through jdk 1.8. We need to fix them.

Some samples: if we ran mvn javadoc:javadoc on yarn-api, here's part of my sample outputs: 
{code}
100 warnings

fields.summary: Fix javadocs warnings in yarn-api for jdk 1.8
Fix @return related javadoc warnings in yarn-api

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

comments.body: I wouldn't be surprised if there were tens of thousands of warnings.  I agree that it's something we should clean up.  Maybe we can treat this JIRA as an umbrella JIRA and file subtasks to address one module at a time.  Otherwise it's going to be more than any one person can fix or review.
Hi [~templedf], sure, let's do that. I agree that there might be tons of them, so we can fix them gradually. Please feel free to open JIRAs to track separate efforts on this. Thanks!
Uploaded a patch at subtask YARN-5429 that addresses the warnings in yarn-api of the type of "no @return" and some others
